channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2023080212
item.description:
Report X-2023080212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080212 SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the IC conveyor belt onto the IC rollers in preparation for loading. The rollers did not have a stop/catch at the end so the bucket rolled off onto the floor and the lid popped loose, causing it to spill. The bucket was returned to an upright position and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were laid down to prevent to any injuries. DescribePack: The bucket was dropped onto its side and the lid popped open. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was returned to an upright position and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were laid down to prevent to any injuries. 2. X-2023080214 SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the IC conveyor belt onto the IC rollers in preparation for loading. The IC rollers did not have a stop/catch at the end and so the package rolled off onto the floor which popped the lid loose and caused it to leak. The bucket was turned back to an upright position to prevent further leaking and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and brought back to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package dropped from the IC rollers onto the floor which caused the lid to come loose and start leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was turned back to an upright position to prevent further leaking and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and brought back to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023070920
item.description:
Report E-2023070920

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: FREER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 20, 2023, at 1800 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Freer, Texas regarding the release of approximately 4,861 gallons of IMP-DCP-2018 (UN1993, 3, III) from the trailer. The release was reportedly due to a blown tire catching the trailer and the entire contents within the trailer on fire, and was contained to a 230’ x 26’ area. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. However, it was reported no liquid product was visible and whatever leaked from the trailer was burned by the fire. No waste was generated from this release.

item.description:
Report X-2023070441

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-15
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO THE IRREG LINE FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE TO DISCOVER A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT THAT HAD SOAKED THE CARDBOARD OF THE BOX THAT CONTAINED IT. THERE WAS NO LIQUID ON THE GROUND. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023070345
item.description:
Report X-2023070345

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED THE DESIGNATED RESPONDERS. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE AREA, UTILIZED DECISIN TREE/RESPONSE SHEETS TO ASSESS THE SITUATION. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER USED SODIUM BICARBONATE ZEP ZORBENT TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL, SWEPT UP ALL CONTAMINATED ABSORBENT, PUT IT INTO ANOTHER LINED SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER THEN TOOK THE PACKAGE TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX, FOUND THAT 1 GLASS BOTTLE WAS BROKEN HAD SOILED THE REMAINING BOTTLES.

item.title: Report X-2023080059
item.description:
Report X-2023080059

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered on preload during unload. package contained hydrochloric acid (corrosive) un1789. package was mishandled and was damaged in the process. OSS from station called emergency response team for clean up. ARC REFERENCE NUMBER IS #4444928408 / CLAIM NUMBER IS 015556016946 JULY 25, 2023 DescribePack: Package was mishandled incorrectly and was damaged DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Emergency response team was called by OSS Marta Alaniz-Burrell for clean up at the station. Two large black salvage drums are in our hazmat cage awaiting for disposition from PGH and further instructions.

item.title: Report E-2023070913
item.description:
Report E-2023070913

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 18, 2023, at 1238 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Victoria, Texas regarding the release of approximately 450lbs of Steel Mill Electric Arc Furnace Dust (Waste Environmentally Hazardous Substances, solid, N.O.S., UN3077, 9, III) from (2) 3,181.7lb supersacks. . The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) supersacks with clean-up material. Being that this original shipment was a waste shipment, this waste continued to its original destination for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023071177
item.description:
Report X-2023071177

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was scanned to work area 141 at 9:43 am on 07/17/2023. Then at 12:01 pm It was scanned code 10 (inspection required). Package was left at QA1 in a plastic bag with the package covered in white paint. When QA arrived in the morning and began to process packages left at QA1 the packages was found in the damaged package area. Upon closer inspection it was found that the package was a HazMat. Package was placed in salvage drum secured to be processed post sort. DescribePack: Inside the package was found 4 x 1 gallon paint cans. All 4 were dented, soiled/stained in white paint, and 1 had its top come off and was empty. 90% of the interior of the package was coated in paint. Approximately 60% of the exterior of package was coated in white paint. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was found inside of a clear plastic bag at QA1 damaged package area. Then placed in a salvage drum by QA when it was discovered that it was a HazMat. After which it was secured to be processed post sort.

item.description:
Report E-2023070806

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid (UN3266) was damaged during transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews observed all the freight was removed and shipped. The two (2) 5-gallon jugs left were not damaged. LSH personnel utilized absorbent wipes to wipe down the impacted area. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070791
item.description:
Report E-2023070791

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics - LHO experienced a UN1263 E347 Genie Blue (APS) Equipment Enamel release from a 5-gallon metal pail and a UN1263 Endura Paint Topcoat A White (APS SA Panel) release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and advised terminal personnel has already conducted cleanup. It was advised approximately 1-ounce of UN1263 E347 Genie Blue (APS) Equipment Enamel was released due to improper loading and 1-cup of UN1263 Endura Paint Topcoat A White (APS SA Panel) released to the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The product were containerized into a 10-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023070333
item.description:
Report X-2023070333

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER E8Y977, AMAZON.COM.KYDC, INC., 11815 ALTERRA PKWY., AUSTIN TX 78758.

item.title: Report E-2023070909
item.description:
Report E-2023070909

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 3, 2023, at 1212 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (5) gallon of IMEP-SAS 2011 (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., (Methanol), UN1993, 3, III) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote due to load shift. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release impacted the whole trailer floor and was contained to a 20' x 5' area in the yard. All waste generated was containerized in the (1) IBC tote that was damaged which was then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2023061425

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER DISPATCHED TO A CALL AT UNLOAD, TOOK FULLY STOCKED AND WEARING MY PPE(BOOTS, APRON, BLUE LATEX GLOVES, SILVER SHIELD GLOVES, GREEN NITRILE GLOVES, YELLOW ARM SLEEVES AND GOGGLES) AND SET UP MY 15 FOOT HOTZONE, RESPONDER THEN VISUALLY INSPECTED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND SAW THAT THE BOX WAS MARKED AS A HAZARDOUS PACKAGEAND ALSO HAD UPS SHIPPING PAPERS ATTACHED TO IT AND A CORROSIVE #8 DIAMOND STICKER, USED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE STEPS ACCORDINGLY. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE PROCEDURE TO CLEANING UP A CORROSIVE SPILL, COLLECTED ALL THE CONTAMIATED PACKAGES IN THE AREA AND RETURNED TO THE DMP AREA.

item.title: Report I-2023050050
item.description:
Report I-2023050050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-06
  • City: PORT ARTHUR
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 00:30 on 1/6/2023, Kansas City Southern Railway's (KCS) Environmental & Hazmat Department was notified of an Ammonia odor in the KCS Port Arthur, TX rail yard. A railroad qualified response contractor was mobilized to investigate the odor. Upon arrival, responders Identified SHPX 221270 as the leaking tank car. Responders dawned proper PPE before ascending the car. Once on top of SHPX 221270 , responders found the A-side liquid valve less than tool tight and the A-side liquid valve plug was also less than tool tight. Estimated release was 3 gallons. The liquid valve and the plug were both secured tool tight. Once secure, the rail car was released back Into transportation. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
